Crimes.Crime_Name: Subversion against democratic government, institutions or processes
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Reporting to the Chinese Embassy and attempting to subvert a Canadian student organization
Crimes.Target_Entity: Non-political student group (CSSA), not democratic government institutions or processes
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Applicant reported to the Chinese Embassy and attempted to influence/subvert CSSA
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Pattern of reporting and subversive conduct toward student organization
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Reports of communication with Chinese Embassy, involvement in CSSA activities
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Activities not directed at democratic institutions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient link between actions and threat to democratic processes
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Applicant inadmissible due to alleged subversion
Crimes.Outcome: Judicial review allowed; decision overturned and remanded
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Assessment of legal interpretation and evidentiary application
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Misapplication of the law regarding target of subversive acts
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Failure to establish that acts targeted democratic institutions

Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Reporting to the Chinese Embassy and attempting to subvert a student organization
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Applicant engaged in pattern of reporting and subversion attempts
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Conduct focused on internal affairs of student group
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Alleged reports to embassy and organizational interference
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Lack of connection to democratic institutions or processes
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to prove targeting of democratic entities
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found applicant inadmissible for seditious intention/subversion
Crimes.Outcome: Decision overturned and remanded for reconsideration
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Interpretation of legal terms and scope of inadmissibility
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Incorrect application of 'subversion' to non-democratic targets
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Misinterpretation of statutory requirements for subversion

Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Reporting on CSSA members to Chinese Embassy officials
Crimes.Target_Entity: Student organization (CSSA), not democratic institutions or processes
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Provided information about CSSA members to foreign mission
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Engaged in intelligence-like reporting within student group
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Information shared did not pertain to state secrets or democratic institutions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No evidence linking reporting to espionage as defined under immigration law
Crimes.Outcome: Decision overturned; case remanded for reconsideration
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Analysis of definition and applicability of espionage
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Misapplication of espionage standard to non-sensitive context
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Failure to establish nexus between actions and threat to democratic processes
